                         <section class="applications-mise-en-page">
                          <section class="admission-texte app">
                           <h2>
                            ADMISSION CRITERIA
                           </h2>
                           <p>
                            Non-European and European students are welcome to apply to the Master WAVES. Requirements are:
                           </p>
                           <ul>
                            <li>
                             A
                             <b>
                              Bachelor (First cycle, 180 ECTS) in Acoustics or related disciplines
                             </b>
                             (mathematics, physics, mechanical, electrical or civil engineering, computer science),
                            </li>
                            <li>
                             <b>
                              English proficiency
                             </b>
                             , as all courses are taught in English. This is assumed for students who are native English speakers, or who have had experience (academic, professional) of more than 6 months in countries where English is the official language.
                             <br/>
                             Otherwise, a
                             <b>
                              certification of CEFRL B2 level
                             </b>
                             is required. It should be obtained by taking a standardized test of English language proficiency such as Cambridge English First, EF SET or TOEFL PBT/IBT. You may find a table of score equivalence at, e.g.,
                             <a href="https://www.efset.org/english-score/">
                              https://www.efset.org/english-score/
                             </a>
                             .
                            </li>
                           </ul>
                           <p>
                            The applications are examined by the selection board of the consortium. The selection criteria, which aims at recruiting top level candidates, will be based on:
                           </p>
                           <section class="bloc-icones app">
                            <section class="icone">
                             <section class="png">
                              <img src="https://master-waves.eu/images/custom/mortarboard.png"/>
                             </section>
                             <p>
                              Academic background (results obtained in previous academic education, university of origin)
                             </p>
                            </section>
                            <section class="icone">
                             <section class="png">
                              <img src="https://master-waves.eu/images/custom/cv.png"/>
                             </section>
                             <p>
                              Curriculum Vitae including English level
                             </p>
                            </section>
                            <section class="icone">
                             <section class="png">
                              <img src="https://master-waves.eu/images/custom/confirmation_1.png"/>
                             </section>
                             <p>
                              Recommendations
                             </p>
                            </section>
                            <section class="icone">
                             <section class="png">
                              <img src="https://master-waves.eu/images/custom/pencil.png"/>
                             </section>
                             <p>
                              Cover letter
                             </p>
                            </section>
                           </section>
                           <section class="admission-texte app marges">
                            <p>
                             Files will be ranked by the selection board and all students that finalized their application will be notified of the decision: main list, reserve list, or rejection.
                            </p>
                           </section>
                          </section>
                          <section class="separation-fond marges" id="self-funded-section">
                           <h2>
                            SELF-FUNDED STUDENTS
                           </h2>
                           <section class="texte-gauche-emjmd app">
                            <p>
                             Self-funded students have to pay registration, tuition fees and other common living expenses.
                            </p>
                            <ul class="text-emjmd">
                             <li>
                              <b>
                               Tuition fees:
                              </b>
                              <br/>
                              <table>
                               <tr>
                                <th>
                                </th>
                                <th>
                                 if coming from European Union
                                </th>
                                <th>
                                 otherwise
                                </th>
                               </tr>
                               <tr>
                                <th>
                                 University of Coimbra (semester 1)
                                </th>
                                <td>
                                 620€
                                </td>
                                <td>
                                 1520€
                                </td>
                               </tr>
                               <tr>
                                <th>
                                 Polytecnic University of Valencia (semester 2)
                                </th>
                                <td>
                                 1423€
                                </td>
                                <td>
                                 1579€
                                </td>
                               </tr>
                               <tr>
                                <th>
                                 Aix-Marseille University (semester 3)
                                </th>
                                <td>
                                 1767€
                                </td>
                                <td>
                                 3711€
                                </td>
                               </tr>
                               <tr>
                                <th>
                                 Total (including additional fees)
                                </th>
                                <td>
                                 4000€
                                </td>
                                <td>
                                 7000€
                                </td>
                               </tr>
                              </table>
                              <br/>
                             </li>
                             <li>
                              <b>
                               Accomodation:
                              </b>
                              about 250€/month for a student room, about 400-500€/months for a studio
                             </li>
                             <li>
                              <b>
                               Food:
                              </b>
                              about 350€/month,
                             </li>
                             <li>
                              <b>
                               Other expenses:
                              </b>
                              about 100-200€/month.
                             </li>
                            </ul>
                            <br/>
                            <p>
                             Other national funding options are available, and applicants are invited to look for alternatives such as grants offered by national acoustical societies (see an extensive list of societies on the website of the International Commission for Acoustics:
                             <a href="https://icacommission.org/members.html">
                              https://icacommission.org/members.html
                             </a>
                             ).
                            </p>
                           </section>
                          </section>
                         </section>

                         <section>
                          <h1>
                           VISITING SCHOLARS
                          </h1>
                         </section>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </section>
               <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1572368418456">
                <div class="sppb-row-container">
                 <div class="sppb-row">
                  <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1572368418455">
                   <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1572368418455">
                    <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1572368458794">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1572368458794">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <section class="visitingscholars">
                          <p class="left">
                           <b>
                            Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree
                           </b>
                           (EMJMD)
                           <b>
                            scholarships
                           </b>
                           are available for
                           <b>
                            visiting researchers
                           </b>
                           who want to carry out
                           <b>
                            teaching assignments
                           </b>
                           and
                           <b>
                            research projects
                           </b>
                           for the Erasmus Mundus Masters WAVES. Scholarships
                           <b>
                            can be awarded to guest lecturers from any country
                           </b>
                           , who bring added value to the student intake in terms of student-centred teaching/lecturing and related activities. They will be
                           <b>
                            selected by the consortium
                           </b>
                           to contribute to the joint programme within the Partner institutions.
                          </p>
                          <p>
                           <b>
                            EMJMD scholars
                           </b>
                           holding an
                           <b>
                            Erasmus Mundus scholarship
                           </b>
                           will:
                          </p>
                          <section class="liste-bloc">
                           <section class="liste-visitingscholars">
                            <p class="liste-numero">
                             1
                            </p>
                            <p class="item-liste">
                             Commit themselves to actively participate in the masters course activities.
                             <p>
                             </p>
                            </p>
                           </section>
                           <section class="liste-visitingscholars">
                            <p class="liste-numero">
                             2
                            </p>
                            <p class="item-liste">
                             Spend a minimum of 1 week in any partner institution.
                             <p>
                             </p>
                            </p>
                           </section>
                           <section class="liste-visitingscholars">
                            <p class="liste-numero">
                             3
                            </p>
                            <p class="item-liste">
                             Perform teaching/research/student tutoring activities in at least one of the partner institution.
                             <p>
                             </p>
                            </p>
                           </section>
                           <section class="liste-visitingscholars">
                            <p class="liste-numero">
                             4
                            </p>
                            <p class="item-liste">
                             Contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the Erasmus Mundus Programme in their university and country of origin.
                            </p>
                           </section>
                           <section class="resume">
                            <img alt="resume" src="https://master-waves.eu/images/custom/resume.png"/>
                           </section>
                          </section>
                          <p>
                           Please
                           <b>
                            send a CV
                           </b>
                           with a teaching project (1 page) describing your possible contribution (teaching / student tutoring) to
                           <b>
                            the project leader Bruno Lombard
                           </b>
                           at
                           <a href="mailto:lombard@lma.cnrs-mrs.fr" style="color:#FDCB0B;">
                            <b>
                             lombard@lma.cnrs-mrs.fr
                            </b>
                           </a>
                          </p>
                         </section>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>

                   </div>

                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        All courses are taught in English so that English proficiency is required. This is assumed for students who are native English speakers, or who can prove an experience (academic, professional) of more than 6 months in countries where English is the official language.
                                       </p>
                                       <p>
                                        Otherwise, official certificates are expected: a CEFRL B2 level, or a similar test, such as Cambridge English First or TOEFL tests.
                                       </p>
                                       <p>
                                        English proficiency may also be evaluated during an online interview.
                                       </p>

                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-FdN7IPVurCospaT-9em6u">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-1WndAwGGLn9qwK_07Srfq">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1WndAwGGLn9qwK_07Srfq">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1633347494459">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1633347494459">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        You should be able to change almost everything in the application documents. You can upload revised versions of the files that you have already uploaded. You can change them even if you have already completed your application. You can also delete previously submitted files. You can use the “Other document” to send extra information. But you will not be allowed to act on the recommendation letters sent directly by your referents.
                                       </p>
                                       <p>
                                        Once you have validated your application, it appears as “Sent”, meaning that you cannot change your form. If necessary, you can
                                       </p>
                                       <ul>
                                        <li>
                                         Go to the “Checklist” tab, then submit a new attachment in the “Other document” section.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         Ask us to change minor things. Be very clear in telling us what should be suppressed and what should be added.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         Ask us to put your application back in the “In Progress (not submitted yet)” status, by sending a message to application@master-waves.eu. You should then be able to make the corrections by yourself. Please do not forget to validate your application again before the application deadline.
                                        </li>
                                       </ul>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>

                  <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1633347494363">

                    <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u">

                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                        <h3 class="sppb-addon-title">
                         Recommendations Letters
                        </h3>
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-0">
                            <span aria-label="The referents I specified did not receive any invitation email." class="sppb-panel-title">
                             The referents I specified did not receive any invitation email.
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 1" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-0">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-DatRdTn4L4vuuxIscAlU_">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-I1MPIJim--zNtUvSwnWHI">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-I1MPIJim--zNtUvSwnWHI">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1633347494485">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1633347494485">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        Main instructions are given in the application platform, in the “References” section (top of the page). You are expected to provide the names, status and contact information of (at most) two referents. They will automatically receive an invitation to provide a online recommendation.
                                       </p>
                                       <p>
                                        Your referents should receive the recommendation request by email as soon as you have filled and closed the “References” form page. If they do not receive the email, it can be due to:
                                       </p>
                                       <ul>
                                        <li>
                                         you have given a wrong email address for your referent.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         the email has been filtered by your referent’s email system. Tell your referent to check their email spam boxes.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         the email has been rejected by your referent’s email system (it can be due to a greylisting system, to the use of email protections such as boxbe, …).
                                        </li>
                                       </ul>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-1">
                            <span aria-label="Can I renew my invitation to my referent(s) ?" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Can I renew my invitation to my referent(s) ?
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 2" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-3cTedhpm1HydllYkXZF4u-key-1" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-H2s4_oUN3SCypZFwy_oh6">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-hVWb9HLgvFvTqHId8CzYI">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-hVWb9HLgvFvTqHId8CzYI">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1633347494460">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1633347494460">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        As long as your application is in the incomplete status (not yet validated), you can send the request again:
                                       </p>
                                       <ul>
                                        <li>
                                         Go to Application form > References
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         Check that the emails that you have given for your referents are valid (try to send yourself an email to these addresses and check that it is delivered). Many emails that we send to the referents get returned due to non-existent email address. We cannot deal with this problem.
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                         At the end of the page, click on “Send the request for individual assessment“. That should send again an email to the referents who have not already replied.
                                        </li>
                                       </ul>
                                       <ul>
                                        <p>
                                         After everything in your application is updated, and after your referents have received their email requests, submit your application again using the Checklist menu / Send your application.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         If your application is in the Sent status (i.e., already submitted), you can ask us to put it back in the In Progress (not yet submitted) status. Do not forget to validate your application again before the application deadline.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         If you are unsuccessful with the previous way of submitting the reference letters, ask your referents to email their recommendation letter directly to
                                         <a href="mailto:contact@master-waves.eu.">
                                          contact@master-waves.eu.
                                         </a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         It is essential that they give in their email: your name, and the exact email address that you have used for your application.
                                        </p>
                                       </ul>

                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <p class="western">
                          The
                          <strong>
                           2024 Edition of the Master Waves Summer School
                          </strong>
                          is about to take place from Monday 17th to Thursday 20th June, at Gandia Campus. The theme of this edition is
                          <strong>
                           New Trends in Ultrasound Applications.
                          </strong>
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          The participants will obtain an up-to-date view of the new trends in the applications of ultrasound, both in the medical and industrial fields. Such applications will include the physical principles of ultrasound propagation and the
interaction between ultrasound and various tissues, including biological tissues. The participants will know the tools for its study and prediction (numerical simulations, theoretical approximations, parameters of interest...).
                          <p>
                           Social activities include
                          </p>
                          <ul>
                           <li>
                            networking sessions,
                           </li>
                           <li>
                            a visit at BRIO acoustics.
                           </li>
                          </ul>
                          <p>
                           Download
                           <a href="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/product_pdf/Schedule_SummerSchool2024_MasterWaves.pdf">
                            detailed program
                           </a>
                           .
                          </p>
                         </p>

                                        .
                                        <p>
                                         Founded in 2004 as an initiative of the GEND CSIC group, DASEL aims from the beginning to develop a wide range of ultrasound systems for quality control purposes. The development of the contactless technology was transferred by the CSIC in 2012 thanks to the NUTHIC project.
                                         <br/>
                                         DASEL combines engineering expertise with advances in ultrasound, we have created turnkey system solutions and offer application development services for new customers. DASEL develop all Ultrasound technology components: include transducers, amplifiers, receivers, and signal processors. These components work together to generate and interpret ultrasound waves..

                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <p class="western">
                          The
                          <strong>
                           2023 Edition of the Master Waves Summer School
                          </strong>
                          took place from Monday 19th to Friday 23rd June, at Gandia Campus. The theme of this edition is
                          <strong>
                           Ecosystems acoustics
                          </strong>
                          which gathers two complementary aspects:
                         </p>
                         <ul>
                          <li class="western">
                           a first part of the Summer school will be dedicated to
                           <strong>
                            Fisheries acoustics tools
                           </strong>
                           with 5 talks
                          </li>
                          <li class="western">
                           then a second part will focus on the
                           <strong>
                            effects of anthropogenic noise
                           </strong>
                           <span lang="en-US">
                            .
                           </span>
                          </li>
                         </ul>
                         <p>
                          Social activities include
                         </p>
                         <ul>
                          <li>
                           networking sessions,
                          </li>
                          <li>
                           a harbour lab visit,
                          </li>
                          <li>
                           a day-long visit to the Tuna tour, i.e., a visit of the Balfegó Tuna
                           <br/>
                           Facilities in L’Ametlla de Mar (Tarragona).
                          </li>
                         </ul>
                         <p>
                          Download
                          <a href="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/product_pdf/Schedule_SummerSchool2023_MasterWaves.pdf">
                           detailed program
                          </a>
                          .
                         </p>

               <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1655322298935">
                <div class="sppb-row-container">
                 <div class="sppb-row">
                  <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1655322298934">
                   <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1655322298934">
                    <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                        <h2 class="sppb-addon-title">
                         Workshop "Fisheries acoustics"
                        </h2>
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-0">
                            <span aria-label="An introduction to fisheries acoustics" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             An introduction to fisheries acoustics
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 1" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-0">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1-AN0gf3WQBNFMF3zuW6K">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-enlgP3R4XL5MInf5AtnNE">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-enlgP3R4XL5MInf5AtnNE">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618257">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618257">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/RolfKorneliussen.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         His talk will introduce the basic concepts and technics of fisheries acoustics.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Rolf Korneliussen
                                         </strong>
                                         is Head of Research/Research Manager of the Department of Marine Ecosystem Acoustics of the
                                         <a href="https://www.hi.no/en/hi/forskning/research-groups-1/marine-ecosystem-acoustics">
                                          Norwegian Institute of Marine Research
                                         </a>
                                         at Bergen. Experienced Principal Scientist with a demonstrated history of working in the research industry, he developed skilled in Physics, Data Analysis, Acoustical, Fortran, and Acoustics. He has a strong research professional with a Doctor of Science focused in Physics (acoustics) from Universitetet I Bergen (UiB), and is a featured member of the Working Group of Fisheries Acoustics (WGFAST) of the International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES).
                                        </p>
                                       </div>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-1">
                            <span aria-label="Estimation of target strength of fish: importance, methodologies and difficulties" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Estimation of target strength of fish: importance, methodologies and difficulties
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 2" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-1" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-2EDT9xsr8PhBXbhxI4pH-">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-WwXGn4l6zF6YRTWXEwAKU">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-WwXGn4l6zF6YRTWXEwAKU">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618258">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618258">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/GuillermoBoyra.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         Estimation of target strength (TS) is fundamental to the acoustic methodology of abundance estimation, as it provides the acoustic response of a single individual, which is the key conversion factor between acoustic measurement and number of individuals. Consequently, a biased TS will result in an abundance bias in the opposite direction. This presentation will cover a basic understanding of target strength and its importance in trawl acoustic methodology. I will also describe the main methods used and the main difficulties encountered when attempting to estimate this important parameter.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Guillermo Boyra
                                         </strong>
                                         (AZTI) is a marine scientist with a background in physics and a PhD in fisheries acoustics. His main research interests are stock assessment using trawl acoustic methods (with a focus on pelagic and mesopelagic species), TS analysis and remote discrimination of fish species and size using acoustic sensors. He has led an annual trawl acoustic survey focusing on pelagic species (JUVENA) since its inception in 2003. He specializes in post-processing acoustic data by writing scripts and is an enthusiast of the open-source R language. He has published more than 30 scientific papers in international SCI journals. He has led about 25 research projects in Spain and participated in several international projects.
                                        </p>
                                       </div>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-2" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-2">
                            <span aria-label="Satellitary buoys and tuna fisheries" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Satellitary buoys and tuna fisheries
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 3" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-2" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-2" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-Ewx0kb7WuCr360ftIz9rc">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id--risQo8Hvg0d_TIyApcQp">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id--risQo8Hvg0d_TIyApcQp">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618259">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618259">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/LucioCalise.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         This talk aims to introduce students to the knowledge of one of the most important industrial applications in fishery acoustics: the echosounding satellite buoys for tuna fishery in tropical marine areas. The talk includes an introductory part where the general aspects of the tuna fishery, from an economic point of view to the purely technical aspects of fishing, will be related to environmental impact problems and management strategies. Subsequently, after an overview of the
                                         <a href="https://zunibal.com/en">
                                          Zunibal SL
                                         </a>
                                         , the modus operandi for the echosounder realization for the satellite buoys will be presented. Finally, working progress and future projects will be described highlighting the technical part and the requests for future acoustic technicians.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Lucio Calise
                                         </strong>
                                         is a physical oceanographer with expertise in fisheries acoustics. He got his M.Sc. in Marine Science at Istituto Universitario Navale of Naples (Italy) and the Ph.D. at Institute of Physics and Technology of the University of Bergen (Norway). His focus interests are narrow- and broadband- acoustic systems realization and acoustical scattering from fluid-like and gas-bearing targets. He has worked in Government institutions and private companies of different countries acquiring a long experience in seagoing operations with scientific and fishing vessels, in- and out-door laboratory works, and data processing and modelling for fishery acoustics. Since almost ten year he is Senior Engineer at the R&D section of Zunibal SL as Acoustic Projects Leader.
                                        </p>
                                       </div>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-3" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-3">
                            <span aria-label="Quantitative assessment with omnidirectional sonars" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Quantitative assessment with omnidirectional sonars
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 4" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-3" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-3" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-s-VnGRWJs57VtS0Zt8Zo8">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-XKzS_PgR_vZ7GDdZOmZ6X">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-XKzS_PgR_vZ7GDdZOmZ6X">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618260">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618260">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <p>
                                         This talk will provide an overview of the use of omni-directional sonars to quantitatively measure the structure, behaviour, and biomass of pelagic fish schools.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Dr. Gavin Macaulay
                                         </strong>
                                         (
                                         <a href="https://aqualyd.nz/">
                                          Aqualyd
                                         </a>
                                         ) specialises in the use of underwater sound to study and monitor the marine biological environment. His introduction to fisheries acoustics was through a Mechanical Engineering Ph.D. on finite element modelling of acoustic scattering. This led to work in the fisheries acoustics field mainly in New Zealand and Norway working on species as diverse as orange roughy, hoki, (southern) blue whiting, herring, Atlantic mackerel, and most recently, Antarctic krill. His main focus has been fish target strength, the use of broadband acoustics, and the standardisation of acoustic data formats.
                                        </p>
                                       </div>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-4" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-4">
                            <span aria-label="Fish behaviour monitoring with broadband echosounders" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Fish behaviour monitoring with broadband echosounders
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 5" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-4" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-MWwyjie7x4IsTgSRWOUl5-key-4" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-amgy_Kybeee7tl_0f6L42">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-art3KZ5lfL-UV96h25tqw">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-art3KZ5lfL-UV96h25tqw">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618261">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618261">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/GeirPedersen.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         This talk will cover recent research utilizing active broadband acoustics to detect and characterize behaviour of fishes with special focus on behaviour response of fishes (avoidance) to research vessels.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Geir Pedersen
                                         </strong>
                                         joined the
                                         <a href="https://www.hi.no/en/hi/forskning/research-groups-1/marine-ecosystem-acoustics">
                                          Norwegian Institute of Marine Research
                                         </a>
                                         in 2019 where he works with underwater acoustics. Specifically, the further development of active acoustic methods for ecosystem monitoring, monitoring of underwater noise and its effect on marine ecosystems, and alternative platforms for acoustic observations (e.g., ocean observatories and remotely operated vehicles). Geir has a PhD in underwater acoustics from the University of Bergen.
                                        </p>

                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618258">

                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <p>
                                         In the talk, topics related to the characterization of acoustic landscapes will be explained, as well as the necessary steps for the proper acquisition of acoustic data and their subsequent analysis, related to the identification of the existing sounds and the development of algorithms.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Guillermo Fernan Lara Martínez
                                         </strong>
                                         studied Telecommunications Engineering at the Universitat Politècnica de València (UPV). In 2016 he obtained his PhD in the analysis and modeling of bioacoustic signals. After working for several years in the Signal Processing Group of the ITEAM - UPV (Institute of Telecommunications and Multimedia Applications) designing passive acoustic monitoring devices and analyzing the acoustic data captured by said devices, he studied the Master's Degree in Electronic Systems Engineering at the Universitat Politècnica de València, thus becoming an electronic engineer. He currently works in the underwater acoustics group of the
                                         <a href="https://www.ieo.es/en_US/">
                                          Spanish Institute of Oceanography (IEO-CSIC)
                                         </a>
                                         and is in charge of acoustic data analysis and the conceptualization and construction of new acquisition devices for their implementation in Spanish Marine Strategies.
                                        </p>

                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-GeUeFsr7vvRr0z7q8tyxm">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618259">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618259">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/ManuelaMauro.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Manuela Mauro
                                         </strong>
                                         is a researcher (biologist and zoologist) at the
                                         <a href="https://www.unipa.it/dipartimenti/stebicef/en/index.html">
                                          University of Palermo, STEBICEF Department
                                         </a>
                                         . She graduated in Natural Sciences and Environmental Sciences and obtained the PhD in International Mediterranean Biodiversity in 2020 studying the acoustic impact of Deep-Sea Mining activities on the behavioral, cellular and molecular responses of vertebrate and invertebrate aquatic organisms. The PhD was carried out in co-tutorship with the Polytechnic University of Valencia. She collaborated with an English company HR Wallingford in Oxford, with the National Research and Promotion Body for Standardization (ENR) and the National Research Council (CNR) in Italy to wrote a technical standard and create a numerical model, useful tools to reduce and contain the acoustic impact on marine biodiversity. Her line of research concerns the extraction of bioactive molecules from aquatic organisms, the evaluation of the health status of aquatic organisms following stressful conditions (e.g., drug pollution, noise pollution, bacterial infection etc.) and the study of biodiversity (e.g., environmental DNA). In particular, the assessment of health following stressful conditions is carried out by studying different biomarkers (e.g., cortisol, total proteins, enzymatic responses, etc.) typical of stress responses on tissues, organs or blood and/or hemolymph samples and studying behavioral responses such as swimming height, group cohesion and swimming speed, which could affect the fitness of a species and the ecosystem itself.
                                        </p>

                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-3" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-3">
                            <span aria-label="Noise from ships propellers: numerical modelling" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Noise from ships propellers: numerical modelling
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 4" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>

                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-3" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-3" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-Ur0M6mVR5j-tKphSGKS7H">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-72tQyE_aJG8qyPR-S1yHt">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-72tQyE_aJG8qyPR-S1yHt">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618260">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618260">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/MartaCianferra.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         The lecture gives a brief description of a recently developed methodology abe to numerically reproduce the noise field of hydrodynamic sources (for example a marine propeller). Subsequently, some results obtained by the fluid dynamics laboratory at the University of Trieste (IE Fluids) are reported and discussed, also paying attention to noise mitigation systems.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         After bachelor’s and master’s degree on Mathematics (at the University of Rome-La Sapienza),
                                         <strong>
                                          Marta Cianferra
                                         </strong>
                                         got her PhD at the University of Trieste in Computational Fluid Dynamics in 2018, the thesis was on hydroacoustics and modeling of cavitation Then, after few years as a post-doc, she is now assistant professor at the University of Trieste, Department of Engineering and Architecture. She joined three main projects (PRELICA, IDROACU, OpenCaviFoam) where the role of the research group she joins was to provide innovative numerical tools for computing noise emissions from ship propellers.
                                        </p>

                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-faq">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-4" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-4">
                            <span aria-label="Seismic methods for environmental and scientific studies" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Seismic methods for environmental and scientific studies
                            </span>
                            <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 5" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                             </i>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-4" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1sC0sTi6mrnBeE9h8lNzq-key-4" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-qCkI6ehYqfSxqF708zEw-">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-R79dLMkKaqhFEDf4RHN_U">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-R79dLMkKaqhFEDf4RHN_U">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618261">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618261">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/UmbertaTinivella.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         Seismic exploration of the Earth has a long history dating back nearly 200 years. The seismic method is based on the generation of propagating waves of alternating pressure that produce localized areas of compression and rarefaction: it depends on the elastic properties of the host medium. With the development of elastic theory, geophysics were able to study the elastic properties of the Earth. Advances in acquisition methods were achieved through the main interest of oil companies in mapping and characterizing oil and gas deposits. Subsequently, the scientific community began to use active seismic to study the subsurface for many purposes, not only for georesource development (including gas, oil, geothermal, and water) but also for fundamental research (e.g., tectonic reconstruction, presence of fluids). In the following, we will discuss methods for data acquisition in marine environments and illustrate elastic wave propagation as a function of subsurface petrophysical properties. Two practical examples will be reported. The first is the gas hydrate case study, which will be discussed to explain the contribution of the seismic method to the net zero carbon challenge, environmental protection, and understanding of past and future climate change impacts on gas hydrate stability. Finally, an example of the use of the seismic method to detect offshore groundwater resources is explained to highlight the contribution of geophysics to answering important questions from civil society.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Umberta Tinivella
                                         </strong>
                                         is employed at the
                                         <a href="https://www.ogs.it/en">
                                          National Institute of Oceanography and Applied Geophysics (OGS)
                                         </a>
                                         with present position as senior geophysicist performing research activity using techniques and approaches of oil and gas upstream in the field of applied geophysics, petrophysics, basin analysis, aquifers, pore fluid analysis, focusing on natural gas hydrates in marine and permafrost environments. In 1998 she received the Cagniard Award for the poster presented at the EAGE Conference. She performed simulation of acoustic wave propagation along the drill string considering the border condition (formation, mud, variable geometry, etc.). She studied the possibility to predict overpressure zones from analysis of seismic, log and laboratory data, by using elastic theories, which relate physical properties of rocks to pore pressure in the frame of EU project. In 2005, she received the Best Poster Presentation at the Near Surface Conference. Presently, she works on fluid topic, considering standard and non-conventional processing of seismic data, such as pre-stack depth migration, Amplitude Versus Offset, seismic inversion, modeling and theoretical models to describe the physical properties of fluid, and in particular gas hydrate- and free gas-bearing sediments. She developed a procedure to estimate the concentrations of gas hydrate and free gas from seismic and well data. She is/was the leader of several Gas Hydrate Project supported by Italian government, Oil Company and EU. She is the author of many technical reports and papers on gas hydrate topic and she received several invitations to present her work. Moreover, she is active on dissemination of her research.
                                        </p>

                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-L9ylQBnEXx-hTOoxiSwow">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-TyqAZ_RbfmS_kZXDEvkmf">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-TyqAZ_RbfmS_kZXDEvkmf">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1688287618262">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1688287618262">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-raw-html">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <div class="bio">
                                        <img class="conf_pic" src="https://www.master-waves.eu/images/custom/SummerSchool2023/AliceAffatati.jpg"/>
                                        <p>
                                         Underwater sounds from anthropogenic sources might affect cetaceans, eliciting masking, behavioral responses, and changes in acoustic repertoires. We do not have enough information to understand the full extent of the issue due to the lack of standardized measurements, scarce information on species distribution, use of habitats, and effects of human-made sources. Once these impacts have been assessed, they need to be translated into effective mitigation measures and policy. Through an interdisciplinary overview of the problem, this talk will explore the biological importance of sound for cetaceans, the differential marine mammal hearing capabilities, and the potential physiological, auditory, and behavioral noise effects on cetaceans.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                         <strong>
                                          Alice Affatati
                                         </strong>
                                         has a background in Engineering, but she has tailored her studies to include Oceanography and Marine Biology. She worked in the acoustic telemetry and bioacoustics field in South Africa and Namibia, focusing on studying the movement ecology of cetaceans and great white sharks (Carcharodon carcharias). She has been investigating bioacoustics, oceanography, and underwater noise at GEOMAR (Germany), at the Laboratory of Applied Bioacoustics (Spain), at the
                                         <a href="https://www.ogs.it/en">
                                          National Institute of Oceanography and Applied Geophysics (OGS, Italy)
                                         </a>
                                         , and at Memorial University (Canada). She was part of a group of experts on the effects of underwater noise in the Arctic Ecosystem in the Framework on the United Nations Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development in the Arctic Ocean, and she is now involved in the JPI Oceans SONORA project “Filling the gap: Thresholds assessment and impact beyond acoustic pressure level linked to emerging blue growth activities”. Alice is currently a Ph.D. candidate at UniTS and OGS researching underwater noise from seismic surveys and its effects on cetaceans.
                                        </p>

Summer School - Edition 2022

The 2022 Edition of the Master Waves Summer School will take place from Monday 20th to Thursday 23rd June, at Gandia Campus.

This edition will be focused on electroacoustics, with a large part of this summer school taking the form of a workshop on Electroacoustics Modeling with COMSOL Multiphysics , along with scientific conferences reporting cutting edge research on nonlinearities in speakers, microspeakers, and active control.

Download detailed program .

Workshop "Electroacoustics Modeling with COMSOL Multiphysics"

From Monday 20th June, 16:00 to Wednesday 22th June, 18:30, RoomA28

In this workshop you will be introduced to the concepts needed for modeling electroacoustic drivers, loudspeakers, horns and more. The course will cover the fundamentals of sound radiation, damping in narrow regions and porous materials, acoustic-structure interaction (vibroacoustics), as well as the electromagnetic forces at play. In the workshop we will also focus on various descriptions and their combinations for efficient modeling, including lumped models, full wave (FEM) models, as well as hybrid FEM-BEM. Finally, some advanced topics will we introduces such as shape optimization and the inclusion of a loudspeaker in a real listening environment like a room or a car.

Mads Herring Jensen joined COMSOL in 2011 and is the technology manager for the acoustics products. Mads has a Ph.D. in computational fluid dynamics from the Technical University of Denmark. Before joining COMSOL, he worked in the hearing aid industry for five years as an acoustic finite element expert..

Conferences

"Microspeakers: challenges and key design factors" by Pablo Seoane

Monday 20th June, 11:00-13:00, Conference Rooms 1&4

The talk will be focused on the key design parameters and challenges when designing a micro speaker:

  • Definition and comparison with normal size electro-dynamic drivers;
  • Small Signal Domain.
  • Large Signal Domain.
  • Why your simulation is not like reality, specially in high frequencies.
  • Why 5 small, simpler simulations can be better than a "digital twin", depending on the specific case.

Pablo Seoane studied Telecommunications Eng, with a specialization in Image and Sound, with intense focus on sound Engineering. He worked in Beyma as Lab technician , then as Main Accounts Support and Product Manage r in Acustica Beyma, followed by 3 years in DAS Audio as Main Loudspeaker Drivers Engineer . Since October 2012, he has been working at Apple as Acoustic Transducer Engineer where he designed the woofers of most iPads, several MacBooks and HomePod. He now mainly focuses in Materials with application in speaker modules.

"Active Control of the field diffracted by the reflecting wall of a semi-anechoic room" by Cédric Pinhède

Thursday 23th June, 16:00-17:00, Conference Rooms 1&4

This study is dedicated to the development and experimental validation of an active acoustic anechoic method to reproduce, in an enclosed space, free field conditions, that is without reflections from the walls. In this work, a strategy for estimating the diffracted pressure is developed from measurements of total pressure on a surface. Active control techniques are then used to drive an array of actuators to minimize the estimated diffracted field. This strategy need to use a reference source. This presentation also deals with the design of a reference source targeting lower audio frequencies.

Cédric Pinhède joined the french national center for scientific reserach (CNRS) in 2003 as an Assistant Engineer . After years working in anechoic chambers, he became in 2019 both a CNRS Research Engineer and a Doctor by defending his thesis on the active control at low frequencies of the diffracted field in a semi-anechoic room . He is continuing his research in this area with a view to creating a passive/active hybrid anechoic room at the Laboratory of Mechanics and Acoustics in Marseille (France).

"The nonlinear loudspeaker model, towards the refinement of a valuable engineering tool" by William Cardenas

Thursday 23th June, 17:00-18:00, Conference Rooms 1&4

The transducer is the weakest part of the audio chain having multiple sources of nonlinear distortion degrading the sound quality. Two groups of nonlinearities describing these sources can be defined; the instantaneous and hysteretic ones. The instantaneous nonlinearities can be accurately explained with Nonlinear models whose parameters depend instantaneously on the states variables of speaker-enclosure system. These instantaneous models are very powerful in predicting the dominant symptoms and can also be used to mitigate them using feedforward control techniques. Unfortunately, the sources of nonlinear distortion related to the ferromagnetic behavior of the soft parts used to guide the static flux in the motor´s magnetic circuit, cannot be described with the mentioned instantaneous models. For this reason, an extension of the transducer model including the complex behavior of soft magnetic materials, like hysteresis, saturation, eddy currents, and instantaneous change of the permeability and inductance is required.   This talk reviews the existing instantaneous nonlinear models and shows through examples, how they can be used for diagnosis; passive design improvements, and active distortion control. We also discuss a candidate hysteresis model suitable to extend the current transducer model, highlighting its implementation simplicity and the powerfulness to predict symptoms such as HD, IMD, Multitone distortion, etc..  exhibited by low-cost transducers.

William Cardenas studied Sound Engineering at the University of San Buenaventura in Colombia and then followed the Master's program in Acoustics Engineering at the Polytechnic University of Valencia in Gandia-Spain. He obtained a Master's degree in Electroacoustics at the University of Le Mans in France with a focus on the measurement of loudspeaker nonlinearities. He joined Klippel GmbH in 2014 as R&D engineer and followed his Ph.D. in loudspeaker modeling at the Technical University of Dresden Germany. He was Transducer Engineer at ORA sound in Montreal and has been electroacoustic consultant for ARYA audio labs in the UK. Currently, he is Senior Acoustic Research and System Design Engineer at ADAM Audio GmbH in Berlin Germany. His main research interests are digital signal processing for the sound quality improvement of transducers, nonlinear modeling of electroacoustic devices, and the development of new measurement methods for audio systems and components.
