               </section>
               <section class="sppb-section accordeon sppb-hidden-md" id="section-id-1575020748194">
                <div class="sppb-row-container">
                 <div class="sppb-row">
                  <div class="sppb-col-md-12 sppb-hidden-xl sppb-hidden-lg sppb-hidden-md" id="column-wrap-id-1575020748195">
                   <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1575020748195">
                    <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper sppb-hidden-xl sppb-hidden-lg sppb-hidden-md" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                        <h2 class="sppb-addon-title">
                         S1 : COIMBRA (UC)
                        </h2>
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-0">
                            <span aria-label="Acoustics and vibrations in buildings and their envelopes (6 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Acoustics and vibrations in buildings and their envelopes (6 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-0">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-VJtiCJLQnJPvXsWu3NUrP">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-KpvFz40-y8q5YVdb-jA4q">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-KpvFz40-y8q5YVdb-jA4q">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087378244">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087378244">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The objective of the curricular unit is to present and deepen basic knowledge in the area of building physics, in what concerns knowledge and abilities related to building acoustics and vibrations. The scope of the knowledge will be extended in order to enable students to: i) understand the physical phenomena of sound and vibration propagation and the basic principles of insulation; ii) understand the behavior of different materials and constructive solutions, regarding sound and vibration propagation and insulation; iii) know and apply the national legislation on building acoustics; iv) know, in generality, the main tests in building acoustics and for materials and constructive solutions' characterization.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-1">
                            <span aria-label="Computational modelling (3 ECTS, methods)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Computational modelling (3 ECTS, methods)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-1" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-qwp1p4l3nIE1URcDoUIEa">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-go86JfPmhvrCqHwV3oA2v">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-go86JfPmhvrCqHwV3oA2v">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1575023203331">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575023203331">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This course intends to give students relevant knowledge regarding the application of numerical methods to acoustic and heat and mass transfer phenomena. It is also intended to allow the student to become familiar with computational modeling techniques and with the use of advanced computational tools, applied to the study of the phenomena mentioned before both in permaneand transient regime. The skills that the students should acquire are related with the solution of problems and with the construction of computational analysis models.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-2" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-2">
                            <span aria-label="Strategies for acoustic and thermal rehabilitation (6 ECTS, applications)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Strategies for acoustic and thermal rehabilitation (6 ECTS, applications)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-2" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-2" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-8BM9znaByjp5FLhUuXLpg">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-U1OoW146x1C_7VPlL0lxi">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-U1OoW146x1C_7VPlL0lxi">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1575023236751">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575023236751">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This unit aims to provide students the possibility of acquiring skills in the area of non- structural rehabilitation of buildings, in particular with regard to their acoustic and energetic performance. Students should acquire knowledge that enables them to define intervention strategies for the rehabilitation of facades, walls, roofs and floors in order to improve their thermal and acoustic performance; they should also understand the interaction and interdependence between these two specialties. They must be able to identify and propose opportunities for improvement of the energy performance of buildings in terms of its technical and energetic systems.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-3" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-3">
                            <span aria-label="Sustainable constructions and materials (6 ECTS, application)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Sustainable constructions and materials (6 ECTS, application)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-3" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-3" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-iXOupyDDi786kDyjw524E">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-ZgVMUuuK3RVCnfFYnH257">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-ZgVMUuuK3RVCnfFYnH257">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1575023279949">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575023279949">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         With this course unit it is intended that the student acquires a set of critical tools and knowledge to help taking, and justifying, technical, methodological and strategic decisions in the context of actions for construction / rehabilitation of buildings and urban structures seeking a "sustainable construction", understood as an integral and relevant parcel of a policy of "sustainable development".
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-4" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-4">
                            <span aria-label="Advanced strategies for sound insulation and noise and vibration control (4.5 ECTS, advanced)." class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Advanced strategies for sound insulation and noise and vibration control (4.5 ECTS, advanced).
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-4" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-4" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-jD7KvRK89qJbYnz-o9LBO">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-rKI2oiEHKw3xaCHb2-5SM">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-rKI2oiEHKw3xaCHb2-5SM">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1575023319739">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575023319739">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This unit aims to provide students the possibility of acquiring skills in the area of building acoustics, in particular with regard to sound insulation and noise and vibration control. Students should acquire knowledge in advanced prediction tools to apply in the design stage of building acoustic situations and also on experimental alternative tools to approach problems related with the product development. They must be able to identify and propose constructive solutions for applications in design stage of building acoustic situations and also in product development process.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-5" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-5">
                            <span aria-label="Instrumentation and acoustic and vibration measurements (4.5 ECTS, methods)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Instrumentation and acoustic and vibration measurements (4.5 ECTS, methods)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-5" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-aFOBAwVglcgFwqz6DjyeK-key-5" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-CRhuWHjikxNEHA5B5thxW">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-WkK7wLOK9haK1sk5q-2qt">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-WkK7wLOK9haK1sk5q-2qt">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1575023417919">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575023417919">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The initial objective of the curricular unit is to present the main measurement equipment used in noise and vibration tests. The scope of the knowledge will be extended to the main legal and normative aspects in acoustic measurements and to the detailed analysis of different in situ measurements and laboratorial acoustic tests, in order to enable students to: i) know the main metrological aspects; ii) know and apply the appropriate normative when establishing the different test procedures; iii) understand the methodologies to analyse, process the registered data and evaluate/present the results of different acoustic tests and measurements.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                        <h2 class="sppb-addon-title">
                         S2 : GANDIA (UPV)
                        </h2>
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-0">
                            <span aria-label="Computer Assisted Design Applied to acoustic engineering (3 ECTS, methods)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Computer Assisted Design Applied to acoustic engineering (3 ECTS, methods)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-0">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-Yg2eDBjf9-LrBfwtj0zlm">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-Jiyb8-naYdQdhQH7MeI_w">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-Jiyb8-naYdQdhQH7MeI_w">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087378244">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087378244">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The aim of the course is to provide the knowledge and skills to represent real space through graphic representation techniques. In the classroom, students will use computer programs to represent real space in 2D and 3D, to be able to simulate spaces acoustically.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-1">
                            <span aria-label="Electroacoustic systems (4.5 ECTS, advanced)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Electroacoustic systems (4.5 ECTS, advanced)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-1" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-pu0atDAhLNLo3wTog6qAO">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-eaIJrHQhf5P4L_Qu9KWPE">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-eaIJrHQhf5P4L_Qu9KWPE">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087713006">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087713006">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Electroacoustic Systems tackles the main aspects related to loudspeaker analysis, design and testing, with special emphasis on industry needs. It is structured in two blocks: (1) Drivers and (2) Enclosures. The first block involves loudspeaker fundamentals, modelling (equivalent circuit), characteristic curves, testing, vibration, radiation and non-linear behavior, as well as some design guides. The second block involves design for loudspeaker enclosures, including driver selection and design of closed boxes, vented boxes, and passive radiator as well as band-pass enclosures. Geometry, diffraction and cross-filter strategies for two- and three-way solutions are also introduced.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-2" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-2">
                            <span aria-label="Musical acoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Musical acoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-2" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-2" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-DPAHv6CzqiBUMTUnHjATo">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-E8klFKHISVxRToQb3hyqN">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-E8klFKHISVxRToQb3hyqN">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087768693">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087768693">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Basic phenomena related to the phenomenology and operation of musical instruments are introduced, including the definitions, and methodologies for understanding the physical models of musical instruments. The acoustic and physical features of the main families of musical instruments are presented.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>

                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-WZAedjWc15nmfzVMtf4Z0">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">

                                       <p>

                                         The purpose of this module is to educate students on knowledge and management of data acquisition systems on different buses and interconnection tools for conducting complex measures (instrumentation systems).
                                        </span>
                                       </p>

                                    </div>

                            <span aria-label="Psychoacoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Psychoacoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>

                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">

                                        </span>
                                       </p>

                            <span aria-label="Room acoustics (3 ECTS, application)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Room acoustics (3 ECTS, application)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-5" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-5" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-DZkvJXdKRjd31YpOFrfsS">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">

                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088054306">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The aim of the subject is providing the knowledge and capabilities for designing rooms (opera houses, conference venues, and so on) from an acoustics standpoint, as well as measuring the acoustic quality of rooms and characterizing materials and devices commonly used for acoustic conditioning.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>

                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>

                            <span aria-label="Simulation techniques in acoustics (2 ECTS, methods)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Simulation techniques in acoustics (2 ECTS, methods)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-6" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-6" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-Bs5c54Ikz_BxdU57MfZKD">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-PYsjmPOxi1CDDzghTEKS9">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-PYsjmPOxi1CDDzghTEKS9">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088356786">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088356786">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The subject introduces students to the field of simulation by means of numerical resolution methods in the field of acoustics, including the Finite Element Method and Finite Differences in the time Domain, focusing on aspects related to numerical modeling, like convergence, stability, boundary conditions and the definition of the mesh.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">

                            <span aria-label="Synthesis and Audio Processing (2 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Synthesis and Audio Processing (2 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-7" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-7" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-4BPOpprTL0a32Q2n2aT2R">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-kUmik398Nme4Kjk84AtbX">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-kUmik398Nme4Kjk84AtbX">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088386526">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088386526">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The aim of the subject is providing the knowledge and capabilities for generating, manipulating and processing audio signals by using digital signal processing algorithms and techniques.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>

                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-8" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-8">
                            <span aria-label="Sound systems (3 ECTS, applications)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Sound systems (3 ECTS, applications)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-8" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-8" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-EexfxBx_5Tb2lcgngarsC">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-J6b34hCGxEd_0XGW4-sz0">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-J6b34hCGxEd_0XGW4-sz0">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088426408">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088426408">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Sound System Design covers the design and implementation of centralized and distributed sound systems, using either analog or digital signal transmission. This subject goes over concepts related with technical and psycho-acoustic concepts related with audio systems. The students will work with tools like computer simulations for sound design, spectrum analyzers, impedance analyzers, and electro-acoustic transfer functions. Special emphasis is done with the DSP techniques available today for setting-up and optimize audio installations.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-9" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-9">
                            <span aria-label="Ultrasounds (2 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Ultrasounds (2 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-9" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-9" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-ub0-0toY9PVbXhjFx6yAb">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-uZPd0qGEEGINZ8u__Pxbj">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-uZPd0qGEEGINZ8u__Pxbj">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088463878">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088463878">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The objective of the subject is to provide the student with the fundamental knowledge about the generation and propagation of ultrasound, and to train him in the design and specification of ultrasonic equipment, both for applications on non- destructive analysis, or information processing, and on power ultrasound, in the medical, industrial, submarine and communications fields.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-10" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-10">
                            <span aria-label="Underwater acoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Underwater acoustics (2 ECTS, fundamentals)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-10" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-10" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-_9mxvjjL9kqLaRbRr-z3n">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-ZI1c9qbULoXUfORYMBqoJ">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-ZI1c9qbULoXUfORYMBqoJ">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088463982">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088463982">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The subject introduces the fundamentals and applications of acoustical techniques for underwater communication, detection and characterization of targets and habitats. The student should achieve the technical understanding and use of basic instruments of underwater acoustics: emitting transducers and hydrophones, single elements and arrays, scientificechosounders and imaging SONARs, etc, and all their applications (underwater positioning, acoustical communication, bathymetry maps, habitat mapping, biomass characterization and estimation, ...).
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-11" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-11">
                            <span aria-label="Research seminars (2.5 ECTS, opening)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Research seminars (2.5 ECTS, opening)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-11" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-Kb06u5PQ7PaNKiYo7Fc5y-key-11" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-J1atJcnUx_AS1Pp5vjE9_">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-lRPiMStUgllbeBlzxdsZk">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-lRPiMStUgllbeBlzxdsZk">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088525344">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088525344">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         The objective of the course is to initiate students into the world of research in the field of acoustics. To this end, a series of lectures is given by prestigious invited researchers.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087378249">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087378249">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                        <h2 class="sppb-addon-title">
                         S3: MARSEILLE (AMU-ECM)
                        </h2>
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <p>
                          <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                           This semester covers all aspects of noise and non-destructive testing, both theoretical, numerical and experimental. These aspects are designed to be in line with the expectations of the industrial and academic world.
                          </span>
                         </p>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_">
                      <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_">
                       <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                        <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                         <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-0">
                            <span aria-label="Aeroacoustics and Vibroacoustics (4 ECTS, advanced)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Aeroacoustics and Vibroacoustics (4 ECTS, advanced)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-0">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-Xdrqb9HnfHw2wR8RxFHc6">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-JlIeBqIH89UfBxICwSjSS">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-JlIeBqIH89UfBxICwSjSS">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087378244">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087378244">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This course aims at deep understanding of the interaction between a vibrating structure of geometry and surrounding fluid. While such situation arises commonly in many case of building acoustics, the underlying physics is much more complex than expected. Nevertheless, the mathematical tools used to solving it are easy to understood and simple to implement. On simple examples, we will present and understand situations such as sound radiation and transmission, fluid-added mass and damping, coincidence frequency, resonance modes, transient regime, far-field radiation and light- fluid approximation. All these principles are easily transposed in building isolation, sound radiation by string instruments, air wing fluttering or acoustics comfort in transports.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-1">
                            <span aria-label="Environmental Acoustics (4 ECTS, applications)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Environmental Acoustics (4 ECTS, applications)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-1" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-9C2uPFzPGwZjDbhtpRd1p">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-nyIgaeg-6df-eT8JMHdSh">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-nyIgaeg-6df-eT8JMHdSh">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087713006">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087713006">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This course introduces the students with environmental noise issues due to surface and air transport systems, with the prediction and the perceptive characterization of the related noise sources and with their reduction by means of passive and active methods. The students will learn how to generate noise mapping of urban environments and calculate standard perceptive metrics of the environmental sounds using state-of-the-art numerical tools. They will also learn the theoretical basis and the experimental implementation of different noise reduction methods for the attenuation of low- frequency sounds using active noise control systems in a duct and in a room as well as the abatement of mid- to high-frequency noise using porous resonance absorbers. This unit will include 2 labs on PCs and 4 experimental labs. It is a prerequisite to Sound Wall, one of the projects of Unit 7, on the design of a mock-up for the most efficient sound wall barrier able to protect living area from urban traffic noise.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-2" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-2">
                            <span aria-label="Waves in Continuum Media (4 ECTS, advanced)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Waves in Continuum Media (4 ECTS, advanced)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-2" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-2" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-I1rwbZWe8vE63ajnU1eEL">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-X5V6vWkhCTe4LP0TQppQX">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-X5V6vWkhCTe4LP0TQppQX">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087957797">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087957797">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This course introduces the fundamental models of wave propagation in fluids and solids. More specific research issues are then addressed, such as the scattering, dissipative effects, the effect of anisotropy and of randomness. Lastly, nonlinear waves are considered, in relation with Unit 3 of S3. The general objective of this course is to provide students with the theoretical tools to address wave phenomena in complex media, for instance metamaterials (Unit 6 of S3). It also provides the foundations for inverse problems and imaging (Unit 5 of S3). Numerical applications of the phenomena will be systematically done, based on the softwares developed by researchers in the Laboratoire de Mécanique et d’Acoustique:
                                         <a href="https://geodynamics.org/cig/software/specfem2d/" style="color: #1e448a;">
                                          Specfem
                                         </a>
                                         and
                                         <a href="http://prospero-software.science/" style="color: #1e448a;">
                                          Prospero
                                         </a>
                                         .
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-3" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-3">
                            <span aria-label="Acoustic Imaging (4 ECTS, application)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Acoustic Imaging (4 ECTS, application)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-3" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-3" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-s_3_0CZg1wrEBq-BM-Glg">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-PhaeaC8Up6II2f8IkH7-B">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-PhaeaC8Up6II2f8IkH7-B">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088017012">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088017012">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         During previous semester basic knowledges (S1: Unit 2 and Unit 6, S2: Unit 4, 7, 10 and 12) are used and completed to address actual challenges in Non Destructive Evaluation and acoustical imaging. Relying with Unit 4, the complex materials of interest which are both biological (cells, bone, etc.) and industrial (welds, concrete, etc.) are described. Then, special attention is paid to experimental and numerical methods essential for damage identification and imaging. Practical applications are related to ultrasonic inspection in an industrial context (nuclear energy, civil engineering, aeronautics) and to medical diagnosis. Experimental knowledge will be developed with phased array ultrasonic, immersion tanks, and acoustic microscopy.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-4" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-4">
                            <span aria-label="Metamaterials (4 ECTS, advanced)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Metamaterials (4 ECTS, advanced)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-4" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-4" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-qPqOQeoBc-f419gVdg6-t">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-lfZDfTYkEo05gSQe3vjbc">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-lfZDfTYkEo05gSQe3vjbc">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088054306">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088054306">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Acoustic metamaterials are artificial media engineered at the subwavelength scale whose effective properties such as negative refraction that cannot be found in nature. This course introduces asymptotic techniques to unveil dynamic effective parameters in periodic structures with resonant behavior. This makes possible negative effective parameters near resonances, and thus the design of an acoustic flat lens via negative refraction. Transformation acoustics (TA) is a mathematical tool whereby a change of coordinates in the wave equation leads to anisotropic heterogeneous parameters. A paradigm of (TA) is the invisibility cloak used to conceal a region of space to sound waves. Asymptotic techniques will be used to approximate the required material parameters for such an acoustic cloak for pressure waves with a structured medium. The course will also touch upon some extension of acoustic metamaterials to the realm of geophysics for the control of surface seismic waves (structuring soils with forests of trees and boreholes).
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-5" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-5">
                            <span aria-label="Nonlinear systems (4 ECTS, advanced)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Nonlinear systems (4 ECTS, advanced)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-5" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-5" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-11vP667A0UaURgNJyap08">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-y2m8K8rtRv8xpA9uIct7z">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-y2m8K8rtRv8xpA9uIct7z">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574087768693">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574087768693">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Linear Acoustics suffices for describing most of the common situations encountered in day life. In some cases, the nonlinear nature of dynamical systems encountered in acoustics (such as musical instruments and nonlinear energy sinks) is of primary importance and it is necessary to be able to recognize such situations. Similarly, the nonlinear dynamical systems are one way to new and original solutions to the acoustic problem. As there are multiple nonlinearities, many methods exist to solve such problem. Most of it are only tractable for the simplest cases, but they suffice to give the idea. Based on simple examples, this course will introduce the main concepts of: phase plane, bifurcations, oscillation regimes, stability, nonlinear modes and chaos.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-6" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-6">
                            <span aria-label="Projects (4 ECTS, opening)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Projects (4 ECTS, opening)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-6" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-6" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-eY0NiyC3wV-L1s10FWQaY">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-4BMJW7nOajRxP6YIM3P9q">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-4BMJW7nOajRxP6YIM3P9q">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088356786">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088356786">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         Projects will be proposed to small groups of students to be carried out over several weeks, on a subject directly from the concerns of the industrial world. The aim is to concretely prepare students for their future profession, to motivate them by material realization, to encourage teachers from different disciplines to work as a team, or to develop a skills-based approach.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
                                 </div>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-custom">
                           <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-7" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-7">
                            <span aria-label="Professional Project (2 ECTS, opening)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                             Professional Project (2 ECTS, opening)
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-7" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-eYmFrknnLZybrsNWynQU_-key-7" style="display: none;">
                            <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                             <div class="sppb-section" id="section-id-nSTVIIGq-0Jl8rYpPHb7X">
                              <div class="sppb-container-inner">
                               <div class="sppb-row sppb-nested-row">
                                <div class="sppb-row-column" id="column-wrap-id-AJ3pHEZMa6hjuzKmrIRI4">
                                 <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-AJ3pHEZMa6hjuzKmrIRI4">
                                  <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                                   <div class="sppb-addon-wrapper" id="sppb-addon-wrapper-1574088386526">
                                    <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1574088386526">
                                     <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                                      <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                                       <p>
                                        <span style="color: #1e448a;">
                                         This training allows to become familiar with the project management tools, in order to appropriate them and to generalize their use during the realization of their projects. This training makes it possible to become familiar with the stages of the life cycle of a project; structure the project team and define the roles and responsibilities of the main actors; to acquire project definition, planning, monitoring and closing tools (project charter, project breakdown structure, liability table, work package, Gantt chart (schedule)), risk register and issues, skateholder influence assessment, communication summary plan, project progress.
                                        </span>
                                       </p>
                                      </div>
                                     </div>
                                    </div>
                                   </div>
                                  </div>
